title: NCREC Leandro Bortolon: Resilience of Cropping Systems

tasks.task: Increase resilience in cropping systems to address drought conditions
subtasks: Reduce tillage to conserve water and reduce evaporation
Incorporate cover crops in crop rotation, especially in fall and late summer
Avoid deep planting (e.g., planting deeper than recommended) to prevent equipment issues and soil crusting
Manage planting speed to prevent soil crust formation and ensure proper crop emergence

tasks.task: Increase organic matter and soil structure for improved water storage and resilience
subtasks: Utilize cover crops to enhance soil structure and aggregation over time
Research and adopt best practices for cover crop integration in North Dakota's cropping systems

tasks.task: Adopt best practices for planting techniques to build resilience
subtasks: Follow recommended planting depths to maintain seed-soil contact and prevent crusting
Adjust planting equipment settings to accommodate potential soil conditions without over-tilling
